alert.note: Alert for Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 21 at 1:01PM PDT until March 24 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...In California, the higher terrain of Western Siskiyou County. In Oregon, Eastern Curry County and Josephine County including the Kalmiopsis Wilderness. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult with snow covered roads and significantly reduced visibility at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may approach 1 inch per hour at times, especially Thursday afternoon or evening. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
